alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Northern Phillips; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 20 at 2:34PM MST until February 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Central and Southeast Phillips, Northern Phillips and Southwest Phillips Counties. * WHEN...For the first Winter Storm Warning, until 11 PM MST this evening. For the Blizzard Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Tuesday. The Winter Storm Warning will resume from 5 PM to 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ranchers should take action to protect newborn livestock.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Phillips; Northern Phillips; Southwest Phillips
